intro: Hieracium mirandum, commonly known as the fairy ring cup plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Hieracium mirandum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
